intro: Xanthoxalis interior, commonly known as the white sand mat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a delicate touch to its habitat. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, with three leaflets that are often covered in fine hairs. Xanthoxalis interior is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
